reviews.sentence: Clean and comfortable convenient for sports fans. The room was clean and comfortable. The location is very convenient to the sports complex but remote to Kansas City nightlife. The bed was amazingly comfortable. There was a deck on the room but the hotel downplayed this fact and does not keep up the decks on the rooms the ledge was covered with bird droppings and the deck entrance was behind a curtain and blocked by a piece of furniture.

Beautiful hotel with only a few minor flaws. The hotel is very nice from the lobby to the rooms. Very comfortable beds. The pool is wonderful with nice cool water. They should add steps or longer ladders to the pool though. The lower step is awfully high when you get out and the ladders are very shaky. The hallways on our floor looked clean but smelled like wet dog. Overall though a really nice place and I would most definitely stay here again.

Satisfied guest. Great stay. a little leary when I drove up but once I walked inside I was impressed. My room was located on the recreational floor. so that was pretty cool. Enjoyed my staff and will consider the hotel again when I am in the area.
Staff and management have been wonderful throughout our 2 night stay. Rooms are great and very clean. Will Def stay here again if ever in this area.

Great location to ball games. Stayed Aug 12015. I read the reviews prior to booking and understand you can not please everyone. My son and I were spending time together before he headed back to college and I was looking for a hotel close to the Royals stadium. great location for ball games. The room was clean walls were not thinnever heard the neighbors and it was games night and hotel was full. tub was clean sheets were clean had enough towels air conditioner blew cold air. The only down side I would say is that it would had been nice if the room had a small fridge and there was complementary breakfast. But all in all it was a nice stay the staff was very friendly and I will stay again.

Great Stay. Royals Game with Hubby. Great location to stay if you are going to the sports complex. My husband and I were impressed with the updates to the hotel. Staff was friendly and attentive when ordering room service. can not beat the price and even received an upgrade with balcony due to limited room availability. Thanks for a great Royals getaway.

Great location for a game. We visited KC to see a Royals game and chose this hotel based on its proximity to Kaufman Stadium. The stadium was right across the street and really easy to walk to. As far as hotels go it was just okay. The walls were paper thin and we could hear our neighbors TV and people in the halls. Luckily the AC unit in our room was really loud and drowned out the outside noises. The decor is modern and appears to have been updated recently. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was spacious. We asked a few staff members for advice on places to eat nearby but no one seemed to be from the area so we just used Trip Advisor and winged it.
Hotel staff and room. Receptionist was polite and friendly even though she was alone abs it was very busy. The room was very nice and we really enjoyed our stay.
Clean rooms friendly staff.
The staff was very friendly common areas and rooms were very clean. We were very impressed.

I checked in going to the room in the basement smells like a wet mildew rug. Got into the room which was supposed to a be a king size bed but instead it was a full size bed in a king room. The room had no phone of which I reported to the front desk. They sent the maintenance who offered me a cord phone base with no handset and to just use the speakerphone no clock radio no menu for what they called room service. You get your food in plastic baskets and styrofoam cups. I went to sleep and woke up to ants and flying insects crawling on what was left of the room service food. I went to tend to my business at 830am but on the way out I told the Housekeeping Supervisor about all the issues. And she told me that everything would be taken care of and my room would be cleaned. I returned at 430 and nothing had been done and there was more insects festering and feeding on the left over room service food. Needless to say I had to stop a housekeeping attendant to clean my room immediately. At this point I can not help the feeling that bugs are crawling all over me and biting me. This is a WARNING to all. STAY AWAY this hotel is the pits and deeper.

Hotel room was clean. Exercise room had more to offer than what I have seen at other hotels. Pool area had a bad smell. When we first checked in and went to our room there were no towels and no hand soap. We went and asked for this and the front desk said they would get to us. It took over two hours before they came to bring us towels and when they did they let themselves in the room instead of letting us open the door. The next day we were out of toilet paper so we went to the front desk to ask for some she checked in her closet and said she did not have any and that they would bring us some. After an hour we still did not have toilet paper and just left because it was time to checkout.
It was ok. It was clean and pleasant. That i did nt get the type of room i booked.

What would expect for price but overwhelmed by compounding issues. This hotel was close to the highway for a quick on off stop. If you are in town for a Royals Chiefs game it would be hard to beat the location. Fairly standard hotel with a fairly nice pool when not hosting a birthday celebrationThis hotel is an older hotel and even though it has been updated its updates are too showing their age. However for the price it is not unexpected. Our biggest issue was with the in room air conditioning. We arrived at the property on a excessive heat warning day around 5 pm and were assigned to a room facing West getting the full effects of the sun beating on the glass doors. When we walked into the room it was excessively hot and the AC was completely off. We turned on the AC clicked the temp as low as it would go and decided to leave the room to give it time to cool down since it was not pleasant for our family to stay in it and wait. We were gone for several hours and when we returned our room was cooler but not nearly as cool as we expected. The AC was still on but had stopped running even though there was no way our room was as cool as the thermostat was set. We added on continuous fan though that should not have anything to do with the cooling but there were no instructions and left for the pool. The pool was nice. Not too hot or cold. Fine for a toddler. However there was a massive party going on and with wild kids everywhere. There were no more clean dry pool towels so my husband had to go up and ask for towels from the front desk. They only would give us 3 even though there are 4 in our family. We got back into our room after dark and it was thankfully cool enough to tolerate. After showering to find the only hook in the bathroom was directly above the toilet paper so nothing really long or wet and getting the kids ready for a very late bedtime storms started rolling in. They ended up being really bad and knocked the power out for the rest of our stay. Around 11 pm when I went to the front desk to inquire if they knew anything about status of power I found irate customers verbally harassing the staff.

Phoning it in. Location is an easy walk to Kaufman Stadium. The room was dirty when we arrived. The couch in the room was covered in dust and human hair. Housekeeping did not visit the room at all our second day and we were out of the room from 10 am till 130 pm Front desk staff was unfriendly when we walked down to ask for clean towels. The hotel is dated but that would not be a problem if it was clean. We just got the feeling that they were not even trying they know they will be full when there is a game.

Worst hotel ever. Nothing. Everything. The first night our phone did not work or air conditioner did not work they had a switch our room. Then they gave archaea to another guest so they try to come in our room when we were there and when I went down to talk to them they did not apologize come to find out they said we never even showed up I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy they ruined our vacation.
Rooms were wore out. Damage to rooms balconies were dirty. Beds pillows not comfortable.

Not happy. Awesome location to be in if going to a game. Room was kind of dirty in the bathroom and had bed bugs. My wife woke up with bed bug bites told the front desk about it and they seemed like they did n’t care. Very disappointed in that.

We were put on the bottom floor but noisy with equipment all night difficult to sleep. Tv did not work only decaf coffee in the morning shower defective. Restaurant not open until evening on Saturday. Totally bad experience will not return.

This place has seen better days that is for sure. I am surprised Sheraton would allow their name on this establishment. We ate in the restaurant and it was really poor. One server for the whole place and the food was very VERY sub par. Would recommend going anywhere else even having Dominos delivered. My room on the first floor was full of mystery stains see curtain photos and other details and problems untouched see gaping outlet pic. It needs a refurb and fast.
